results.definition: an official written record of names or events or transactions
a cashbox with an adding machine to register transactions; used in shops to add up the bill
indicate a certain reading; of gauges and instruments
record in a public office or in a court of law

examples: Did you register any change when I pressed the button?

results.definition: have one's name listed as a candidate for several parties
a book in which names and transactions are listed
an air passage (usually in the floor or a wall of a room) for admitting or excluding heated air from the room
a regulator (as a sliding plate) for regulating the flow of air into a furnace or other heating device
(computer science) memory device that is the part of computer memory that has a specific address and that is used to hold information of a specific kind

examples: Did this event register in your parents' minds?

results.definition: manipulate the registers of an organ
(music) the timbre that is characteristic of a certain range and manner of production of the human voice or of different pipe organ stops or of different musical instruments
record in writing; enter into a book of names or events or transactions

examples: I'd like to register this letter
